bui

Class MiniMapCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
              • bui.MapCanvas
                • bui.MiniMapCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseMoveListener, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener

    public class MiniMapCanvas
extends MapCanvas
    A minimap to parallel the full size game map and facilitate navigation subclass of MapCanvas that overrides the viewPortDraw method with a colored pixel for each tile.
    Author:
    nelsoncs
    See Also:
    MapCanvas

    • Method Detail

      • viewPortDraw

        public void viewPortDraw(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Event event)
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Build the map on a Canvas: probably should be named DrawCanvas, does not really define a viewport. Function actually draws the entire map regardless of visibility in the shell/canvas.

        Overrides:
        viewPortDraw in class MapCanvas

      • mouseDoubleClick

        public void mouseDoubleClick(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e)
        Double click on MiniMap changes the active Tile and also<\b> x_ and y_ori for the full size MapCanvas. This behavior is different than the double click on the full size map. Dbl clk on the full size map changes the active tile, but not<\b> the x_, y_ori pair.

        This function has to have x and y sign flipped and also flip the sign for the adjustment term when compared to the drawViewport function in MapCanvas.<\p>

        Specified by:
        mouseDoubleClick in interface org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseDoubleClick in class MapCanvas
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent
